author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Wednesday said that Kripa Shankar Pandey, the jail superintendent of Kishanganj, who was seen in a video allegedly molesting a young girl, had been “suspended with immediate effect and all necessary action will be taken against him”.

The video involving Pandey had gone viral and the local administration had ordered an inquiry into it.

A woman police officer, Kamini Bala, interrogated the jail superintendent. “The jail superintendent has admitted that he was in the video but the girl was like his daughter and that there was nothing wrong in hugging her,” Ms. Bala told journalists.

However, she said, “Prima facie, the act of the jail superintendent in the video looks inappropriate and against our culture.”

In the video purported to have been shot on Monday, Pandey is shown hugging and touching a young girl inappropriately in the courtyard of his official residence. The girl is said to be the step-daughter of a provision store owner.

In a similar incident in July 2015, Pandey had hit the headlines when a video showing him forcing a woman inmate to have sex with him had gone viral.

The video was reportedly shot by some prisoners who had also alleged that Mr. Pandey used to indulge in even unnatural sex with jail inmates. Pandey, though, had denied the charges at that time and no action was taken against him.

Footage of Kripa Shankar Pandey touching her inappropriately

has gone viral
title: Nitish promises action against jail official who molested girl
